description: From pot +‎ luck. According to the Oxford English Dictionary, sense 3 (“a shared meal consisting of whatever guests have brought”) is unlikely to have been influenced by potlatch even though it has the same meaning.

nouns.description: potluck (countable and uncountable, plural potlucks) (also attributively)

entries.meaning: (dated) A meal, especially one offered to a guest, consisting of whatever food is available.
examples: Here are some leftover beans and meat; we can make a good potluck stew from them.

entries.meaning: (by extension) Whatever is available in a particular situation.
(originally Canada, US) A shared meal consisting of whatever guests have brought (sometimes without prior arrangement); a potlatch; also, a dish of food brought to such a meal.
(obsolete) The last draft or portion of an alcoholic beverage in a pot or other drinking vessel.

verbs.description: potluck (third-person singular simple present potlucks, present participle potlucking, simple past and past participle potlucked)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To take part in a potluck, where each participant brings a meal to be shared by all.
